sdgs.relevance:
In general, educational health content customized per disease can be shared through the Connect For Life platform with the targeted patient population and this can impact the following SDG targets:
SDG 3.3.1: Using the communication from Connect For Life, patients can be stimulated to adhere to their HIV medication intakes and in so doing reduce their risk of transmission to other non-infected individuals. Educational content can also be shared in a discrete fashion to ensure that risks of transmission are known. This educational content can be important for many HIV patient groups such as adolescents, MSM, HIV-infected pregnant women to help prevent transmission to sexual contacts and or to unborn babies.
SDG 3.3.2: For TB patients adherence to medication for longer treatment periods is critical to achieve cure. Messages from Connect For Life can take the form of engaging, actionable instructions to help motivate individuals to adhere to therapy and thereby help them to reach care and preventing further transmission.

SDLC
Agile Scrum approaches
User stories
Change management using version control
Code review
Security & Consented Access
Create strong passwords for username/ password authentication
Enable resource access authorization i.e. access control rights/ permissions
Leverage IT auditing
Protect data at rest (data encryption

schedule backups)
Protect data in transit (encrypt data in transit using TLS/SSL
use X.509 certificates to authenticate the remote end)

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism:
Since the solution is built on OpenMRS, it has the capability to extract data via APIs in the JSON or XML format. Reports can also be extracted and created via CSV.

Furthermore, the ETL Lite Module can also be used to extract data from relational databases, transform it using Velocity templates, and then load it into an OpenMRS system using the application provided Spring services:
https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-module-etllite

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
typesOfPIIDataCollected:
Name (in some specific deployments)
Participant identifier
Year of birth
Address location
Health information
Mobile phone number
Passport-like picture
dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity:
Data in the system is being encrypted in transit (HTTPS TLS 1.3) as well as in rest, depending on the configuration (e.g. AES-256) Passwords are additionally encrypted following the OpenMRS standard via SHA-512. Access to the system is user based controlled with different roles and responsibilities that segregate administrators from the regular users.

https://demo.jnj.connect-for-life.org/openmrs/login.htm 

Our source code has been scanned prior to release to identify any security issues.

documentation:
Access to an Administrator as well as a Developer set of documents is available on the wiki as per link shared: 
https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki
Installation instructions as well as release notes are available in relation to the software version.
Documentation details:
•	Overview / Business goal: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki
•	Architectural diagrams: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Developer-Architecture
•	Technology stack / Platform: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Developer-Release-Notes
•	Installation guide: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Developer-Installation-Guide
•	User Guide: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki (menu USER GUIDE - Modules)
•	Source code reference: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson (multiple modules)
•	API reference: In swagger docs (only accessible for admin)
•	Release notes: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Developer-Release-Notes
•	Contributing guide: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/CfL_Governance_Board

userContent.contentManagement: Content is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
contentTypes:
Personal identifiers such as:

Participant ID
Mobile phone number
A person's interactions with the platform (when required in context of research deployments)
userContent.contentManagementPolicy:
Data entry fields have edit checks for certain data formats that prevent the entry of inappropriate and illegal content.
Access limitation to authorized persons only is also foreseen to prevent the entry of inappropriate and illegal content. Audit trail can highlight unauthorized attempts to enter the system.
Oversight of the platform is held by a system administrator who can filter out any inappropriate entries.

The terms of use of the software also clearly states that "under no circumstance shall Implementor use, reproduce, make available, display, perform, distribute or exploit the Connect for Life™ software in a manner or for a purpose that is intentionally dishonest, misleading, fraudulent or negligent, or which may cause harm, injury or damage to a third party" - https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Software-Terms-Of-Use

name: Connect For Life
description: Connect for Life™  is a communication platform build on OpenMRS. The platform engages with patients remotely and provides continuity of care with proven implementation feasibility in HIV, TB, COVID-19 case surveillance and vaccination programs.

privacy.privacyCompliance:
Connect For Life has been developed under consideration of privacy relevant standards, including security and privacy by design (see more details on the webpage: https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Software-Terms-Of-Use) 

Connect for Life platform was part of an external review of our digital assets in light of GDPR and African Union (AU) equivalent regulations:
GDPR
AU Treaty
privacy.privacyComplianceURL:
As the platform code is being provided in open source, it is not possible for the developer (J&J) to provide evidence of how other organizations applying the open source code have implemented the system and whether they are compliant with their local regulations or international regulations pertaining to data privacy.
Our terms of use are clear regarding to the responsibility of users of the software code to be compliant with local regulations guarding data privacy and data security:
https://github.com/johnsonandjohnson/openmrs-distro-cfl/wiki/Software-Terms-Of-Use
